alert.note: Alert for Eastern Chittenden; Western Chittenden (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 5:19PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Chittenden County through 545 PM EDT... At 519 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Colchester, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Essex Junction, Burlington International Airport, Burlington, South Burlington, St. George, Winooski, Essex, Colchester, Essex Junction Village, Williston, Richmond, Jericho, Jericho Village, Hinesburg, Milton, Westford, Shelburne, North Williston, Malletts Bay, and Coates Island. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 76 and 98. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Lake Champlain, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
